turns.content: What are some vegan options to explore in London?

1. Mildred's - a vegetarian and vegan restaurant offering a range of dishes inspired by world cuisine

2. The Gate - Another vegetarian and vegan restaurant offering Mediterranean, Middle Eastern, and Asian-inspired cuisine.

3. Vurger Co - A fast-food joint offering vegan burgers and sides like fries, onion rings, and mac & cheese.

4. Redemption - A healthy restaurant with vegan and gluten-free options; they also offer a range of alcohol-free cocktails.

5. Genesis - A plant-based eatery offering globally inspired cuisines like falafel wild bowls and crispy seitan schnitzel.

6. Tibits - A vegetarian buffet with over 40 dishes, most of which are vegan or suitable for vegans.

7. Wahaca - A Mexican chain restaurant offering a range of vegan options, including tacos, burritos, and quesadillas.

8. Veggie Pret - A vegan and vegetarian takeaway chain offering sandwiches, wraps, salads, and sweets.

9. Cookies and Scream - A vegan bakery that serves cookies, brownies, cakes, and ice cream.

10. The Canvas Cafe - A cafe styled as a social enterprise and community space. The cafe specializes in vegan breakfast, lunch, coffee, and cake.
I've been to Wahaca before, but I'm really interested in trying Mildred's and Redemption. Have you been to either of those?

I haven't had the opportunity to visit any of the restaurants myself, but i can tell you that mildred's and redemption are both popular vegan restaurants in london.

mildred's is known for its unique and flavorful plant-based dishes inspired by cuisines from around the world, such as the sri lankan sweet potato and okra curry and the mexican black bean burger.

redemption offers a healthy vegan and gluten-free menu, with dishes like red lentil shepherd's pie, jackfruit tacos, and zucchini and spinach fritters. they also serve a range of alcohol-free cocktails, which is quite unique.

both restaurants have great reviews from customers and are definitely worth checking out if you're looking for delicious vegan options in london.
That all sounds amazing! I can't wait to try them out. Do you have any recommendations at Mildred's or Redemption?

I don't have personal taste preferences or experiences to draw recommendations from, but i can tell you about some popular and highly recommended dishes at both mildred's and redemption.

at mildred's, some of the standout dishes include the sri lankan sweet potato and okra curry, the smoked tofu, lentil and bean chili, and the classic burger, which features a homemade patty with vegan cheese, pickles, and relish.

at redemption, some customers rave about the red lentil shepherd's pie, the jackfruit tacos, and the zucchini and spinach fritters. for drinks, you can try one of their popular signature non-alcoholic cocktails, like the apple mock-jito or the super green smoothie.

both restaurants have more extensive menus, so there's plenty to explore and discover on your visit!
Those dishes all sound so appetizing. I'm definitely going to have a hard time choosing what to order! Do you know if either of the restaurants take reservations?

Yes! Both Mildred's and Redemption take reservations. Mildred's recommends booking ahead to avoid disappointment, especially during busy periods like lunch and dinner. You can book a table on their website or by calling the restaurant.

Redemption also accepts reservations online or by phone. However, they don't book the entire restaurant, so there may be some availability for walk-ins as well. If you're planning to visit at a peak time, it's always best to reserve your table in advance to ensure you get a spot.
I'll definitely book ahead to ensure I can try those delicious dishes at Mildred's and Redemption. Can't wait to have a taste of their vegan cuisine!

I'm sure you'll enjoy your visit to Mildred's and Redemption. Their menus both look amazing and there are certainly plenty of vegan options to try. Have a great time exploring the vegan food scene in London!
